name: Megalith
definition: Megaliths are either a large stone or a group of large stones used to construct prehistoric structures or monuments. Greek word 'mega' meaning great and 'lithos' meaning stone.

name: Monolith
definition: A geological feature that consists of a single massive stone or rock.  When the term is used in architecture it can overlap with megalith.  Greek word 'monos' meaning one and 'lithos' for stone.

name: Neolithic
definition: In Greek 'neos' meaning new and 'lithos' meaning stone.  Neolithic represents the 'New Stone Age', a period in which humans consistently begin to farm, create pottery,  designed advanced stone tools, and expand cultural behaviors

name: Millet
definition: A highly variable small-seeded grasses, grown around the world as cereal crops.  Millet played a pivotal role in the rise of human farming and settled societies

name: Wheat
definition: Wheat is a grass cultivated for its seed which is a cereal grain.  It is said to be first cultivated around 9600 BC in a region in the Middle East known as the Fertile Crescent

name: Fertile Crescent
definition: A crescent shaped region in the Middle East known as one of the cradles of civilization.  Due to climatic shifts this region produce many 'r' type annual plants which produce more edible seeds.  This phenomenon combined with variety in elevation also produced many species of these special plants.  Also home to many grazing animals which would later be domesticated.

name: Barley
definition: A member of the grass family, one of the first cultivated grains particularly in Eurasia early as 10,000 years ago.

name: Pre-Pottery Neolithic (PPN)
definition: A period dating from 12,000 to 8,500 years ago in the region of the Fertile Crescent.  During this period the domestication of plants and animals was in its formative stage.  It is popular to name timelines inside of this overall period as Pre-Pottery Neolithic A and Pre-Pottery Neolithic B.  Pre-Pottery Neolithic A encompasses the timeline from 10,000 BC to 8,800 BC.  It is characterized by tiny circular mud-brick dwellings, crop cultivation, hunting of wild animals, and burial customs where bodies are buried below the floors of dwellings.  Pre-Pottery Neolithic B spans from 8,800 BC until 6,500 BC.  In this period animal domestication was more prevalent,  flint tools were more advanced, and the beginnings of the pottery age were taking shape.

name: Younger Dryas
definition: A period from around 12,900 to 11,700 years ago where the Earth suddenly entered an ice age rather quickly over the course of a few decades.  This rapid change would have created advanced evolutionary selection pressures and also probably played a role in the course humanity would take after this period.

name: Sickle
definition: A sickle is an agricultural tool designed with a curved blade used for harvesting or reaping grain crops.

name: Proto-city
definition: A Proto-city would have been any large village or town existing the in Neolithic period which had both rural and urban features.  It's differing aspect from a true city would have that it lacks planning and centralized rule.

name: Mesopotamia
definition: Situated within the Tigris-Euphrates river system in the Northern part of the Fertile Crescent,  Mesopotamia has been a key region in the rise of human civilization.

name: Wheel
definition: When combined with an axle a wheel is a simple machine used in multiple applications such as moving heavy loads or forming rotating clay into pottery.  By using a bearing, round hole through which the axle passes, friction in movement is dramatic reduced requiring significantly less energy when applying force or work.

name: City-state
definition: A City-state is an independent city that serves as the central location for political, economic, and cultural life over its contiguous territory.

name: Green Sahara
definition: Due to the varying patterns of Earth's orbit and rotation that occur over thousands of years,  there are periods of time where the Earth receives much more solar radiation comparatively.  Over the Northern region of the African continent,  this increased solar radiation would have created a less dense hot air mass over the continent creating a inward flow of moisture from the atlantic of a cooler more dense air mass.  This brought cycles of increased precipitation lasting thousands of years that would have turned the modern day Sahara into a green Savannah type landscape.

name: Phalanx
definition: A military formation requiring infantry to form a large rectangular group protruding with long spears held by each member.

imageAttribution.author: F. Mitchell, Department of History, United States Military Academy
